item.title: Report X-2024120368
item.description:
Report X-2024120368

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-20
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DATA ACQUISITION CLERK SCANNED BARCODE, "HAZARDOUS MATERIAL" SHOWED UP ON THE SCREEN. DATA ACQUISITION GAVE PKG TO HAZMAT AUDITOR. NO INDICATION OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS, OR REGULATED ITEMS. SHIPPER INPUT PKG IN HMMS AS "UN 3481, CLASS 9." AUDITOR CALLED SHIPMENT INTO UPS HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SUPPORT CENTER (HMSC). HMSC INQUIRED ABOUT THE CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE (2 LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CHARGER PACKED WITH A CORDLESS SAW.) HMSC INSTRUCTED THAT THE BOX BE HELD PENDING REGULATORY INSPECTION/RELEASE. UNDECLARED

item.title: Report X-2024120375
item.description:
Report X-2024120375

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-15
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DATA ACQUISITION CLERK SCANNED PKG AND SAW THAT THE PKG WAS IN THE SYSTEM AS A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL. DATA ACQUISITION GAVE THE BOX TO THE HAZMAT AUDITOR TO INVESTIGATE. SHIPMENT IN HMMS AS "UN 3481." PACKING SLIP INDICATES THAT THE CONTENTS ARE A FESTOOL CORDLESS TRACK SAW. THIS PRODUCT INCLUDES TWO LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, THE TOOL, AND A CHARGER. NO HAZMAT OR LITHIUM BATTERY MARKINGS ON THE BOX OR THE THERMAL LABEL. CALLED INTO HMSC.

item.title: Report E-2024120060
item.description:
Report E-2024120060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2152 ET, Carla Paul with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XHG. It was reported that approximately 25-gallons of Dibromo-3-NITRILOPROPION AMIDE released from a plastic drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted inside of trailer #3117679 and asphalt. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. A contractor was dispatched and observed an estimated release of 20-gallons onto the wooden trailer floor in a 10’x5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 20’x5’ area. The contractor neutralized the release soda ash and absorbed the spill with oil dry. The damaged drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon DF. The neutralized impacted absorbents and pallet pieces were containerized into two 55-gallon DF’s. All waste generated was left on-site for XPO to manage. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024120021
item.description:
Report E-2024120021

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0326 ET, Kevin Boswell with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XPB. It was reported that approximately 0.5-cups of Unisol® Liquid Red BK-50 released from a tote due to a packaging defect. The release impacted concrete dock floor. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-inch of residual product released. The shipper was contacted who stated the 1-inch residual was okay to ship back. The contactor secured the leaking valve as much as possible after draining the remaining material out of the valve and relayed most of the residual product out of the tote and secured the damaged valve for it to be transported back to the shipper. The contractor confirmed there was no waste generated from the tote transfer.

item.title: Report E-2024120036
item.description:
Report E-2024120036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight material handler discovered a drum that was slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation discovered that a protruding nail on the pallet the drum was staged on had punctured the bottom of the drum consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.
